conclusion: Analyze forces to find coefficients of friction and angle.
A suitcase is shown which can be pushed or pulled.
Identify forces: Weight, Normal Force, Applied Force, Frictional Force, Supporting Force.
Given values: Mass = 15 kg, g = 10 m/s², F_min = 90 N, θ is angle.
Resolve applied force into components: F_x = F cos θ, F_y = F sin θ.
Determine normal force: N = W - F sin θ.
Determine frictional force: f = μ (150 - F sin θ).
Apply Newton's Second Law for uniform motion: F cos θ = μ (150 - F sin θ).
Substitute given values and solve for μ: μ = 3 cos θ / (5 - 3 sin θ).
Use minimum applied force condition to find θ = 37°.
